item.title: Racist right wing graffiti, 21st September

item.title: Not informed of works and gas cut off, 21st September
item.description:
Hi, there have been works going on outside our flat for over a week now, and we had no letter informing us of it. Worse, we have had no gas since Friday without being informed. Based on this, the affected flats are due compensation.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Whiston Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot hole middle of road by bus stop, 21st September
item.description:
Pot has been there for months and not be repaired I’ve reported it months ago and still not be fixed!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 24, St Paul's Wood Hill, St Paul's Cray, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Graffiti and dirt on bike stores, 21st September
item.description:
Good morning, I’m writing again in regards to the same case logged as: FixMyStreet ref: 8188592. This morning I received an email from you stating : “ We have provided you with advice. Your case is resolved and closed.” Firstly, you have not sent me any advice. Secondly, the bike stores have not been cleaned up and the graffiti has not been removed. Therefore on what grounds are you stating that this case has been fixed. It appears nothing has been done about it. I request information where and how I can make a formal complaint about your services. Regards, Tomasz Abramowicz

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Victory Place, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Right wing agenda flag, 21st September
item.description:
A right wing vandal thinks it’s ok to spray paint the cycle path flags. This demeaning act impacts property values and creates the impression we are gammons. Please remove the paint.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brandon Close, Grays
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish, 21st September
item.description:
There are overflowing charity collection containers and now people are dumping everything and anything on the paved area. It is not charity donations. It is rubbish and waste. It is disgusting and unmanaged. It is never cleared and looks like the containers are not attended for regular emtying

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Orangery Lane, Well Hall, London

item.title: St George’s flag graffiti on bollards, 21st September
item.description:
There is graffiti on all the bollards around Elmer’s End roundabout and also on Eden Park Avenue. It looks sloppy and unsightly and makes the area appear aggressive and unwelcoming. There are also union flags and St George’s flags tied to lampposts which may also cause a distraction to drivers. While people are free to express their views, this is public property and vandalism.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Faversham Road, Beckenham, London

item.title: Damage to trees, 21st September
item.description:
There are 2 young trees close to the fence between Bexley and Greenwich where the casings and support have been removed/smashed by vandals and the 2 young trees are now very wobbly and unsafe. Could the casings/support please be rebuilt? Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Parish Gate Drive, Falconwood, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree in picture is slowly falling over., 21st September
item.description:
The tree on Brackley Road, outside St Merryn Court flats has slowly been tipping to the left. In the high winds we recently had it has blown further over. It looked like it was going to be uprooted. It needs to be fastened back to the post.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 18, Brackley Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bags of domestic waste dumped on pavement, 21st September
item.description:
Bags of domestic waste have been dumped on corner of Maple Crescent opposite side wall of Candy Box shop. The contents have been pulled out all over the pavement. This is now a health hazard and will encourage foxes and rats. Can this be cleared ASAP please. I have no idea if there is anything sharp or hazardous amongst the waste.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Maple Crescent, Blackfen, London
Report on FixMyStreet
